alert.note: Alert for Logan County; Phillips County; Sedgwick County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 4:42PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Logan, Phillips and Sedgwick Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 442 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout tornado 5 miles southeast of Crook, or 25 miles northeast of Sterling, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts possible, wind gusts up to 50 mph, and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Landspout tornadoes can damage mobile homes, roofs, vehicles, and trees. Outdoor objects may be tossed about. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sterling, Holyoke, Julesburg, Haxtun, Fleming, Ovid, Iliff, Peetz, Sedgwick, Crook, Paoli, Padroni, Atwood, Marks Butte, Westplains, St Petersburg, Proctor, North Sterling Reservoir, Willard and Amherst. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for northeastern Colorado.

area.areaDesc: Logan County; Phillips County; Sedgwick County
